description:
welcome to the wisteria lane SUPERCUT. this video contains all 8 of my previously uploaded DH videos in one place for your convenience.

0:00:00 SEASON ONE
2:12:36 SEASON TWO
4:11:31 SEASON THREE
5:31:04 SEASON FOUR
6:48:23 SEASON FIVE

9:41:00 SEASON SEVEN
11:29:22 SEASON EIGHT

season two resource links:
The Brute Caricature - Jim Crow Museum
https://jimcrowmuseum.ferris.edu/brute/homepage.htm

Popular and Pervasive Stereotypes of African Americans - National Museum of African American History and Culture (includes an excellent list of resources!)
https://nmaahc.si.edu/explore/stories/popular-and-pervasive-stereotypes-african-americans

The Cool, the Square and the Tough: The Archetypes of Black Male Characters in Mystery and Crime Novels - Gary Phillips, The Black Scholar
https://www.jstor.org/stable/41068771

Negro Stereotypes in Children's Literature: The Case of Nancy Drew - James P. Jones, Journal of Negro Education 
https://www.jstor.org/stable/2966721
(although this 1971 article is older than the other provided readings, I really wanted to include a mystery-specific resource. this journal article can be read by logging into your library OR by creating a free personal jstor account, which gives you access to 100 free articles per month!)

The evolution of Black representation on television - Lori Harwood, the University of Arizona
https://news.arizona.edu/story/evolution-black-representation-television

The Manifestation of Black Stereotypes in Todayâ€™s Media - Mecca Mustafa, Black Explosion News
https://www.blackexplosionnews.com/blog/2017/9/30/the-manifestation-of-black-stereotypes-in-todays-media

Teaching About Race and the Media - Julian Hipkins III, Civil Rights Teaching
https://www.civilrightsteaching.org/teaching-race-media

title: 'Desperate Housewives' Teri Hatcher & James Denton Gush Over Reuniting For Christmas Movie
description:
This TV couple is teaming up yet again! James Denton and Teri Hatcher reunited nearly a decade after playing a married couple on "Desperate Housewives" for their new Hallmark Channel Christmas movie.  They spoke to Mario Lopez and Kit Hoover on Access Daily with James saying, "I knew if we could get Teri, we could make a movie, and if I couldn't get her to do it, I wasn't going to do it." "A Kiss Before Christmas" premieres Nov. 21 at 8PM on the Hallmark Channel.

title: Lynette has a contentious exchange with Nora | Desperate Housewives
description:
After revealing that Tom fathered her child, Nora demands back child support.

From Season 2 Episode 23 "Remember" - Lynette's suspicions that Tom is having an affair with the newly arrived Nora prove to be erroneous, however, the two are forced to deal with the revelation that she is the mother of his child from a one-night stand from eleven years ago. 

About Desperate Housewives:
Set on Wisteria Lane, a street in the fictional town of Fairview in the fictional Eagle State, Desperate Housewives follows the lives of a group of women as seen through the eyes of their friend and neighbor who took her life by suicide in the pilot episode. They work through domestic struggles and family life while facing the secrets, crimes, and mysteries hidden behind the doors of theirâ€”on the surfaceâ€”beautiful and seemingly perfect suburban neighborhood.

The series features an ensemble cast, headed by Teri Hatcher as Susan Mayer, Felicity Huffman as Lynette Scavo, Marcia Cross as Bree Van de Kamp, and Eva Longoria as Gabrielle Solis. Brenda Strong narrates the series as the late Mary Alice Young, appearing sporadically in flashbacks or dream sequences.

description:
This is a fully human-made video designed by me, using my own ideas with help from Canva and CapCut, and is intended for narration and educational use in line with Fair Use.
This short explores the dramatic final season of Desperate Housewives and why Teri Hatcher was reportedly banned from set farewells. From Los Angeles filming tensions to her name being omitted from parting gifts, Teri Hatcherâ€™s story highlights real-life exile behind Hollywood drama. Based on verified sources like Wikipedia, IMDb, People and TV Guide, this video complies with YouTube's content policies and is meaningful for older audiences.

title: The Feuds, Drama, Crimes & Controversies of the Desperate Housewives Cast
description:
Desperate Housewives was being watched by over 30 million people during its first season in 2004. During that first season, the show won dozens of awards, being parodied on Saturday Night Live & late night, & the shows commercials and billboards were everywhere. One other thing that made Desperate Housewives even more famous was its problems behind the scenes, especially between its cast. The drama went mainstream when the Desperate Housewives cast had an explosive shoot with Vanity Fair that was so outrageous that Vanity Fair actually called the cast out in the accompanying article. 

From that point on, people became just as interested in the behind the scenes drama as they were in the show itself. But it wasnâ€™t just the cast that were putting a strain on production, many allegations surrounded the showrunner Marc Cherry, how he conducted himself on set & how he treated his writers & his cast. Culminating in one of the Desperate Housewives lead actresses filed a lawsuits against creator and show runner Marc cherry and the show itself. So thatâ€™s what weâ€™re discussing today, the drama, conrtoversies, lawsuits and allegations surrounding Desperate Housewives. Weâ€™ll also cover each of the individual cast members controversies over the years and after the show, including one of the housewives taking a storyline from the show a little too seriously. This controversy led to a media firestorm that resulted in a lead award winning actress in handcuffs and behind bars. So sit back relax and letâ€™s dive into the secret, tense, drama filled and desperate lives of the desperate housewives cast.

title: Desperate Housewives - Gabrielle & Bree und der Wagen von Tante Shirley
description:
Desperate Housewives (deutsch: â€žVerzweifelte Hausfrauen") ist eine US-amerikanische Dramedy-Serie von Marc Cherry, die von Oktober 2004 bis Mai 2012 von ABC Studios fÃ¼r den US-Sender ABC produziert wurde und ab April 2005 auch in der Schweiz, in Ã–sterreich und Deutschland ausgestrahlt wurde.

Im Mai 2012 wurde die Serie nach acht Staffeln und 180 Episoden mit einem zweistÃ¼ndigen Serienfinale beendet.

Die Serie handelt von den Erlebnissen der vier Nachbarinnen und Freundinnen Susan Delfino (geb. Bremmer), Lynette Scavo (geb. Lindquist), Bree Weston (geb. Mason) und Gabrielle Solis (geb. Marquez) und deren Familien sowie von Edie Williams (geb. Britt), Katherine Mayfair und Renee Faulkner. Sie alle leben in der Wisteria Lane in der fiktiven Stadt Fairview im fiktiven US-amerikanischen Bundesstaat Eagle State. Dabei werden diese einzelnen Geschichten mit einem Ã¼bergeordneten Handlungsbogen verwoben, der sich in jeder Staffel um die ErgrÃ¼ndung eines Geheimnisses dreht. Mary Alice Young, die Hausfrau, die in der ersten Episode Selbstmord begeht, kommentiert von da an das Leben ihrer Freundinnen.

Lynette Scavo versucht eine â€žSupermutter" fÃ¼r vier Kinder zu sein. Gleichzeitig visiert sie ihre RÃ¼ckkehr in eine leitende Position in einem Unternehmen an, die sie zugunsten ihrer Kinder zunÃ¤chst aufgegeben hatte. Da ihr Ehemann Tom beruflich stÃ¤ndig auf Reisen ist, erhÃ¤lt sie von ihm kaum UnterstÃ¼tzung in Erziehung und Haushalt und greift aus Verzweiflung sogar zu den ADHS-Tabletten ihrer Kinder.

Bree Van de Kamp, Mutter von Andrew und Danielle, bemÃ¼ht sich, die perfekte Hausfrau zu sein, ihre inzwischen zum Alltag verkommene Ehe zu retten und mit ihren pubertierenden und aufmÃ¼pfigen Kindern zurechtzukommen. Sie freundet sich immer mehr mit ihrem Apotheker George Williams an, der sich vorgenommen hatte, Brees Herz um jeden Preis zu erobern, und dazu ihrem herzkranken Ehemann Rex ein falsches Medikament unterschiebt, das letztlich fÃ¼r dessen Tod verantwortlich ist. AuÃŸerdem erfÃ¤hrt sie von der HomosexualitÃ¤t ihres Sohnes Andrew.

Susan Mayer ist alleinerziehende Mutter. Mit Karl Mayer, dem Vater ihrer Tochter Julie, war sie zuvor 12 Jahre lang verheiratet. Die oft sehr ungeschickt agierende Susan hat auf der Suche nach der groÃŸen Liebe ein Auge auf ihren neuen Nachbarn Mike Delfino geworfen. Da Edie es ebenfalls auf den gutaussehenden Klempner abgesehen hat, entsteht zwischen den beiden ein Eroberungskampf um die Gunst des Junggesellen, in dessen Verlauf Susan sogar â€žunabsichtlich" Edies Haus niederbrennt.

Gabrielle Solis heiratet als Model den gutverdienenden GeschÃ¤ftsmann Carlos Solis, der ihre Liebe mit teuren Geschenken erkauft. Sie gibt ihren Job auf und sie ziehen in die Wisteria Lane. Wegen seiner stÃ¤ndigen Abwesenheit langweilt sie sich und fÃ¤ngt eine AffÃ¤re mit dem GÃ¤rtner John Rowland an, die sie fortan vor Carlos zu verheimlichen versucht. Es beginnt daraufhin ein Katz-und-Maus-Spiel, das darin endet, dass Carlos seine Frau durch ein Baby an sich binden will. Da Gaby jedoch niemals Kinder haben wollte, manipuliert Carlos ihre Pille, so dass sie schlieÃŸlich schwanger wird. Allerdings ist sich Gaby nicht sicher, wer der Vater ist. Carlos landet im GefÃ¤ngnis, weil sein gewaltsames Vorgehen gegen vermeintliche Nebenbuhler von der Justiz als homophob motiviert interpretiert wird.

Edie Britt, zweifach geschiedene Immobilienmaklerin, hat einen Sohn, der bei ihrem Ex-Mann lebt. Sie beherrscht bestens die â€žWaffen einer Frau", die sie auch jederzeit einsetzt, um an ihr Ziel zu gelangen. Nachdem Susan Edies Haus niedergebrannt hat, sucht Edie Anschluss, nimmt regelmÃ¤ÃŸig an den Tratsch- und Pokerabenden von Bree, Gaby, Lynette und Susan teil und wird Teil ihrer Gruppe.

title: Bree wants a divorce.ðŸ˜£ #movie #film #movieclips #shorts
description:
Desperate Housewives is a fascinating American drama that shows life from a unique perspective.
The plot is well-designed, centering around several housewives in Wisteria Lane, using black humor to interweave elements of marriage, family, and friendship, like Gabrielle's derailment and Lenette's dilemma of returning to her family, full of drama and reversal, with a 
tight plot and no urination point
throughout.
Characterization is excellent, Susan is naive, romantic and a little reckless, in love, constantly in pursuit; Bree is a perfectionist, the family will be well organized, but it is difficult to hide behind the marriage crisis and children's problems; Lenette bold and strong, in the family and career between the difficult to balance; Gabrielle is beautiful and sexy, in the marriage of the mansion is experiencing a self-struggle. Their distinctive personalities, their strengths and weaknesses are very real, making it easy for the audience to empathize with them.
The production level is also very good, the scene highly reproduces the middle-class life, costumes and props fit the identity of the characters. The narration is philosophical, such as â€œWe are all waiting for a special person who can bring us what we can't haveâ€, adding depth to the drama.

title: Eva Longoria Reacts to â€˜Desperate Housewivesâ€™ Photos & Family Memories | PEOPLE
description:
Eva Longoria takes a touching and hilarious walk down memory lane as she looks back at personal photos from her life and career. From growing up in Texas with her three sisters to landing her breakout role on â€˜Desperate Housewivesâ€™, Eva reflects on the pivotal moments that shaped her journey. She starts with a sweet childhood snapshot from the 1980s complete with trendy feathered hair.

Eva recalls feeling unsure during the â€˜Desperate Housewivesâ€™ pilot and nervously debuting her new highlights after producers asked her to change her hair. She reacts to a shot from the show's very first photoshoot, long before the series became a phenomenon. Then itâ€™s off to the Cannes Film Festival in 2005, where Eva wore a $39 gold dress she bought off the rack on Melrose Avenue in Los Angeles. She didnâ€™t know how to react when photographers asked her who she was wearing: â€œI was so naive in the best way.â€

Later, Eva reflects on motherhood and shares an adorable photo of her young son visiting her on the set of her directorial debut â€˜Flaminâ€™ Hotâ€™. "He was a COVID baby, so I was home when he was 2 and 3. So when I went back to work when he was 4 years old, he was like, 'Where are you going?" she says. She wraps up with a glamorous pic from her 50th birthday party â€” and a last-minute fashion twist involving lost luggage.

title: Why Does Everyone LOVE Bree Van de Kamp from "Desperate Housewives"?
description:
I know, I know. Literally no one asked for it. But I am really passionate about this show, and I had to dump my passion into a video sometime soon. And this character is by far my favorite from this show. That's not exactly an unpopular opinion, either. Most fans are extremely drawn to Bree Van De Kamp, and there's several reasons why.

She's not necessarily always my favorite housewife, as this show goes on for a really long time, so there are times I prefer Gabby's storyline, or Lynette's...Susan's not so much. But that's for another video. But either way, I always rooted for her success and cheered every time she bested her foes. She eats up every scene because of the great casting and the textured writing.

By the end of the series, it's hard not to be in love with her from her growth, and to want the absolute best ending possible because of the work she's put in. It's truly a feat for to watch this character throughout the seasons becomes someone so lovable and warm, despite the cold place she began in.

I know this was unasked, but I hope you enjoyed nonetheless! I clearly spent a lot of time talking about her. What inspired this to be my longest video? Who knows...

title: How NOT To Write Men in Television. | Desperate Housewives
description:
Pretty much everyone who watches this show at the very least complains with Tom Scavo, but there is a general problem with how men are written and judged on Wisteria Lane. Lots of their toxic behavior is accepted, and even in a show that revolves around women, they somehow always seem to make the problems about them, and devalue the emotions of the women in their lives.

It's truly disappointing, but it is important to point out nonetheless. As I say in this video, positivity isn't about blindly ignoring flaws and only "focusing on what's good", it's about recognizing flaws as well as strengths so that we can all do better in the future. So I hope this video was informative!

title: The Defense of Susan Mayer from "Desperate Housewives".
description:
This one's bound to get me in trouble. One of the most hated/disliked protagonists I've seen in television fiction. Even more surprising was...I never hated her. Of course, it takes a lot for me to hate a character in the first place, but still- I just never felt that disgust that people tend to take with her. In fact, I found her to be the creator of some of my favorite comedic moments from the series. I'm not defending everything she's done- far from it- but I still never truly hated her.

And, by the end, I felt satisfied by her arc. I won't pretend the writing for this show is perfect, but I do understand the writer's intention and truly feel Susan has transformed by the end of season 8, and grew into a much better person. Not perfect, but better. And I appreciated the development they did give us, and when Susan recognized her mistakes.

description:

About Desperate Housewives: The first season of Desperate Housewives introduced Susan Mayer, the divorcee and single mom; Lynette Scavo, who went from her career in advertising to being a stay-at-home mother; Bree Van De Kamp, who resembles Martha Stewart on steroids; and Gabrielle Solis, the ex-model with everything she's wanted; and serial divorcee Edie Britt, the real estate maven whose love life has everyone buzzing.
 
About Prime Video:
Want to watch it now? Weâ€™ve got it. This weekâ€™s newest movies, last nightâ€™s TV shows, classic favorites, and more are available to stream instantly, plus all your videos are stored in Your Video Library. Prime Video offers a variety of unique and captivating entertainment, including original series â€œThe Boys,â€ â€œInvincible,â€ â€œHazbin Hotel,â€ â€œThe Summer I Turned Pretty,â€ and more.

title: s1e9 Learn English Naturally: 10 Phrases from Desperate Housewives You Need!
description:
This episode focuses on 10 essential expressions from Desperate Housewives, Season 1, Episode 9, "Beneath the Facade: Betrayal and Redemption". We'll provide their meanings, context from the show, and practical usage examples to help you integrate them into your own conversations, allowing you to use phrases like "lost it," "cut short," and "happy as a clam" more naturally and confidently.
=================
English learning is a life long journey, so it needs to be a lot of fun. Learn English expressions, phrases, idioms, vocabulary words with short videos, movies and TV shows, full of real life example sentences. Great stuff for English shadowing, mimicing, listening and speaking.

title: Desperate housewives - THE END
description: Wisteria Lane Ã¨ una sorta di percorso formativo che aiuta gli abitanti ad abbattere ogni lato oscuro della loro vita.  Bree, inizialmente maniaca della perfezione e dell'ordine che non lasciava spazio ai sentimenti, si ritroverÃ  completamente immersa nel caos piÃ¹ totale che la porterÃ  ad intraprendere scelte moralmente riprovevoli e scellerate fino al momento in cui capirÃ  che il condurre uno stile di vita immacolato non deve e non puÃ² compromettere la propria felicitÃ  e a quella delle persone amate; Lynette che inizialmente era una madre esasperata con un continuo bisogno di sentirsi realizzata, capirÃ  invece di essere effettivamente una donna felice a cui non manca veramente niente; Susan nel suo percorso di crescita finirÃ  con l'abbandonare tutto per dedicarsi a suoi figli e al nipotino, diversamente dal passato quando invece non riusciva ad essere un valido modello per la figlia Julie che risultava addirittura piÃ¹ responsabile e matura di lei; Gabrielle, inizialmente egoista e superficiale, capirÃ  invece l'importanza di sacrificarsi per il bene degli altri, incominciando a lavorare e volendosi falsamente accusare dell'omicidio di Alejandro per salvare suo marito Carlos. Come giÃ  ricordato piÃ¹ volte, Marc Cherry, aveva in mente il finale giÃ  da sette anni e mezzo: la serie ruota tutta attorno ai concetti di ciclo e di crescita, dei quali Wisteria Lane si fa protagonista. Non a caso nell'ultimo episodio assistiamo ad una nascita (figlio di Julie), un matrimonio (di Ben e Renee) e ad una morte (della signora McCluskey) che avvengono nello stesso istante. Con l'arrivo poi della nuova arrivata che andrÃ  a vivere nella casa di Susan, si dÃ  il via al nuovo ciclo e allo stesso tempo comprendiamo come in realtÃ  le casalinghe siano riuscite ad affrontare i loro problemi e quindi non abbiano piÃ¹ bisogno di Wisteria Lane: andandosene, lasciano spazio a coloro che invece devono ancora vedersela con i loro piÃ¹ profondi segreti.

title: Desperate Housewives: How Susan Became The Show's Accidental Villain... | Explained
description:
Go to http://zocdoc.com/thetake to find and book a top-rated doctor today! ðŸ“º Susan Mayer was Desperate Housewivesâ€™ â€˜anchor characterâ€™ â€“ the everywoman who show creator Marc Cherry designed to be loveable and relatable. But although on paper Susan was inoffensive, there was something about her that audiences loved to hate. Over the course of eight seasons, the Housewives met with murder, fraud, bribery and so much more â€“ soâ€¦ what exactly was it about Susan, a seemingly innocent girl next door type, that made her the showâ€™s unintentional villain for so many?

title: Desperate Housewives' Bree: Breaking Free From The Secret TradWife Misery | Explained
description:
Desperate Housewivesâ€™ Bree Van de Kamp portrayed herself as the perfect #tradwife: always put together, conservatively dressed, prim and straight-laced. She functioned as the more old-school, uptight end of Wisteria Laneâ€™s gaggle of housewives, and the show used her to unpack some of the darker truths about what itâ€™s really like to force yourself to exist within that constricting, traditional outlook on life â€“ and what can happen when one opens themselves up (even just a tiny little bit) to new ways of thinking.

title: Desperate Housewives 6x20 "Epiphany" QUICK CUT
description:
Uploaded : 27/04/2010

Previously on Desperate Housewives 6x20 "Epiphany" :

We meet Eddie's mom Barbara, a mean, slovenly drunk. She raids his room, looking for a bottle of Scotch, but instead finds his scrapbook with the clippings about the Fairview murders.

We flashback to when Eddie was just four, and his father left his mother -- after loudly proclaiming that he'd never wanted any of this, including Eddie. Mary Alice tries to befriend her, but Barbara isn't interested. Mary Alice stops by one day to give Eddie a teddy bear and finds him home alone while his mom is out drinking. She lectures Barbara about not putting her needs ahead of her son, but the lesson clearly doesn't take.

Gaby first meets Eddie when she moves to Wisteria Lane and finds a lonely Eddie inside her empty house -- he'd been sneaking in to play there since the previous owners moved out. He ends up coming over every day because Barbara has a new boyfriend. When he surprises Carlos and Gaby in the tub, Carlos orders Gaby to "cut him loose" and start making friends with other women, not nine-year-old boys. Gaby wants to go talk to Barbara, but Carlos advises her, "We don't want to be known as the nosy neighbors." After Gaby tells him they can't be friends anymore, Eddie grabs a BB gun and shoots a bird. 

We next see teenage Eddie doing chores for Bree. He tells her "girls never notice me" and she gives him dating advice. She even gives him extra money to buy gifts for the girl he likes. Bree goes to talk to Barbara when Eddie's object of affection ends up being Danielle! She returns the necklace Eddie left for Danielle and asks Barbara to "let Eddie down easy." Instead, Barbara tells him that he needs to stop "stalking" Danielle. Worse, she goes on to say, "The only girl I ever thought he'd end up with would be blind, deaf or inflatable." Bree tells him Danielle and he can still be friends. Our heart breaks for Eddie when he tells Bree, "I don't want a friend. I want somebody to love me." Next, we see Eddie with a hooker. When she laughs at the flowers he's brought her, he kills her.

Susan meets Eddie at the coffee shop just after Mike starts dating Katherine. She praises Eddie's drawing and even pays for him to take art classes. So Eddie is crushed to hear that she and Mike are back together -- and getting married! "Don't marry Mike. You could marry me," he offers. Not realizing he's serious she thanks him for the "good laugh." Eddie tears up the drawings he made of her. That night, we see Eddie prowling outside her house and when he sees a woman come out, he attacks her, only then seeing that it's Julie, not Susan. He runs off, but then brings flowers to her hospital bedside. "What kind of monster would do this?" Susan asks. "It wasn't a monster," Eddie says. "This was done by some piece of garbage that doesn't even deserve to be on this earth."

Eddie is playing charades with the Scavos when his mother comes over, demanding to know where he hid her booze. "I don't think you should talk to your son like that," she tells Barbara. Lynette tells Tom, "We know something bad is happening, but we do nothing. I'm tired of being one of the people who does nothing," she says. Tom suggests Eddie's old enough to strike out on his own, but Lynette thinks he's "too damaged." 

Meanwhile, Barbara is confronting Eddie about his scrapbook. "Did you have anything to do with hurting those girls?" He nods and she sobs, "I didn't raise you to be like this." "Didn't you?" he asks. "The worst mistake I ever made in my life was having you," she spits out and he hits her with a bottle, then chokes her to death. Just then, Lynette shows up to ask him to move in with them. "You've got to get out of here, Eddie," she tells him. "This isn't a healthy situation." She sees his mother on the floor and assumes she's just passed-out! Eddie accepts Lynette's invitation, then disposes of his mother's body.

title: Desperate Housewives Star Teri Hatcher Opens Up On The Reunion Rumours | This Morning
description:
She shot to fame as roving reporter Lois Lane, blew us away as a Bond girl, and this year marks twenty years since she first starred as the loveable Susan in Desperate Housewives. Now, golden-globe winning actress and Hollywood star Teri Hatcher joins us to celebrate the re-imagining of one of her hit films Coraline. And, as rumours swirl about a Desperate Housewives reboot, could a return to Wisteria Lane be in the works? Plus, find out what Teri did recently to be kicked off a dating app.Â 

Broadcast on 12/08/2024
Subscribe to This Morning for more exclusive videos: http://bit.ly/1JM41yF

FOLLOW US:

Welcome to the official This Morning Channel! title: Neal McDonough: How Hollywood Shunned Me for Refusing On-Screen Kisses
description:
Actor Neal McDonough opens up about his career struggles after taking a stance against on-screen kissing.
    Discover how this decision led to:
    * Losing major roles in shows like Desperate Housewives and Suits
    * A two-year job drought in the entertainment industry
    * The impact on his identity and personal life
    * His journey back to success with shows like Yellowstone and American Horror Story
    Watch to learn more about Neal McDonough's experiences and the importance of staying true to one's values in Hollywood.
    
    #NealMcDonough #Hollywood #ActingCareer #EntertainmentNews
tags: Neal McDonough,Hollywood Backlash,On Screen Kissing,Acting Career Struggles,Desperate Housewives,Suits,Yellowstone,American Horror Story,Entertainment News,Celebrity Interviews

title: The daily routine of a housewife #desperate housewives #shorts #ltâ€™s a blessing and a curse
Who Would Need The Most Convincing For A Desperate Housewives Reboot? | WWHL
channel_title: Watch What Happens Live with Andy Cohen
description:
Eva Longoria opens up about the chances of a Desperate Housewives reboot and spills on who would need the most convincing to return! Eva explains why creator Marc Cherry might be the toughest holdout after so many seasons. Plus, Sandra Bernhard talks about moving her stand-up show from a downtown hotspot to an Upper East Side institution.

'Watch What Happens: Live' is Bravo's late-night, interactive talk show that features guests from the world of entertainment, politics, and pop culture. Hosted by Andy Cohen, the series includes lively debates on everything from fashion, the latest on everyone's favorite Bravolebrities, and what celebrity is making headlines that week. Past guests who have joined Cohen in the Bravo Clubhouse include Sarah Jessica Parker, Tina Fey, Khloe Kardashian, Jennifer Lopez, Liam Neeson, Kelly Ripa, Jimmy Fallon, Anderson Cooper, Jennifer Lawrence, and Lance Bass.

title: THE STORY OF Dylan Mayfair IN Desperate Housewives include THE SCENE of Lyndsy Fonseca 2OF5
description:
ALL RIGHT BELONG TO ABC SHOW Desperate Housewives.
When Dylan need to research her father for a school project her mother tells her the truth that her father was abusive and violent the part turn out to be true but it wasn't the whole truth...
When an ex patient of Adam Dylan step dad come back from Chicago we find out the real reason why the family came back and as a result Katherine through Adam out. When Adam packing he finds the note Aunt Lilly wrote and Dylan doesn't like the idea of him moving out. We find out that he never knew the whole truth also Dylan hopes that now he will tell her the truth but Adam still cover for Katherine
EPSIOD USE: S04E07, S04E10, S04E11, S04E12.
